topology

Class Topology2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • topology.Topology2D

  • public class Topology2D
extends java.lang.Object
    An object that specifies how a CellArray2D should retrieve neighborhoods. This object specifies the size and geometry of neighborhoods in the client CellArray2D and specifies an identity space over the client.
    Author:
    Zach Tidwell
    See Also:
    Base}, {@link Space}, {@link CellArray2D}, {@link Automaton2D},

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Topology2D.Base
      An enumeration of the supported neighborhood geometries: Moore, Von Neumann, Left Corners, Right Corners, Horizontal, Vertical, Left Diagonal, Right Diagonal.
      static class  Topology2D.Cylinder
      A topology inner class for subsets of R^2 that directly identifies the left and right boundaries to each other and all points on the top and bottom boundaries are identified with themselves.
      static class  Topology2D.Klein
      A topology inner class for subsets of R^2 that identifies the left and right hand boundaries to each other with a 180 degree twist and directly identifies the top and bottom boundaries to each other.
      static class  Topology2D.Moebius
      A topology inner class for subsets of R^2 that identifies the left and right hand boundaries to each other with a 180 degree twist and all points on the top and bottom boundaries are identified with themselves.
      static class  Topology2D.Space
      An enumeration of the supported identity spaces: Standard, Cylinder, Moebius Band.
      static class  Topology2D.Standard
      The Standard topology inner class for subsets of R^2 where all boundary points are identified with themselves.
      static class  Topology2D.Torus
      A topology inner class for subsets of R^2 that directly identifies the left and right boundaries to each other and also directly identifies the top and bottom boundaries to each other.

    • Field Detail

      • coarseness

        public final int coarseness
        Represents the granularity of this topology, or in other words, the radius of the neighborhood about a given Cell. 1 is this finest topology and the topology becomes coarser for each successive int value. A topology can have arbitrary coarseness.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Topology2D

        public Topology2D(Topology2D.Base basis,
          int coarseness,
          Topology2D.Space space)
        Creates a Topology2D object that specifies how a CellArray2D should retrieve neighborhoods. The given Basis specifies the geometry of the neighborhood. The supported neighborhood geometries are enumerated in Topology2D.Base. Moreover, the size of this neighborhood is controlled by the coarseness parameter. Coarseness can be any int value, but if coarseness is negative, the absolute value will be used. The space parameter specifies which identity functions this Topology2D should provide to the target CellArray2D. The Types of identity spaces supported are enumerated in Topology2D.Space.
        Parameters:
        basis - The neighborhood geometry selected for this topology
        coarseness - sets the size of the neighborhoods about a given Cell.
        space - The identification space associated with this Topology.
